Judul: STUDY OF WASTE COLLECTION MODELS FOR SLUM SETTLEMENTS IN RIVER BANK SWAMP AREAS A CASE STUDY; MUSI RIVER BANK SETTLEMENT IN PALEMBANG, SOUTH SUMATERA, INDONESIA
Abstrak:
High population density accompanied by topography in the form of tidal swamp
areas has resulted in increasingly complex solid household waste problems.
Therefore, it requires integrated waste handling from storage, collection,
transportation to environmentally friendly management. For Palembang case, the
most complicated problem is garbage collection. The main objective of this study
was to find the solid household waste collection method that was most suitable for
slum areas with tidal swamp topography.
To achieve these objectives, the author assess the weight of factors and alternatives
using the AHP (Analysis Hierarchy Process) method. The final result of this
analysis is to determine the electability of one of the several alternative schemes
offered that are considered to be most suitable for the conditions of the study
location based on the opinions of experts to be obtained through expert
questionnaires.
The results of the analysis show that the most influential factor in determining the
solid household waste collection model in the study area is social capacity and
followed by space availability and accessibility. Meanwhile, the method of garbage
collection using the house to house collection system is ranked as the most suitable
alternative for the study area.
Fakultas: Sekolah Arsitektur, Perencanaan dan Pengembangan Kebijakan
Kata Kunci: household waste, swamp, slum, AHP, waste collection, influential factors
